footer-item.tezblock: tezblock is a block explorer for Tezos an open-source platform for assets and applications backed by a global community of validators, researchers, and builders.

resources-wallets.introduction_1: A list of wallets that support the Tezos protocol for transactions, delegations or other operations. Please help us to keep the list updated and

airgap.title: AirGap
airgap.description: With AirGap your old smartphone is your new ‘hardware wallet’. Securely store your tez with the unique two device approach where one device is completely offline, delegate your Tezzies from cold storage and earn rewards. AirGap's focus is on accessible security, providing best in class security while maintaing a great user experience.
airgap.features: Offline device, Highest security, tez delegation, Coin agnostic, Secure storage, Social recovery, Hot wallet option

atomic.title: Atomic Wallet
atomic.description: Atomic is a decentralized wallet that supports 300+ cryptocurrency assets. Strong encryption and custody-free solution guarantee their users the highest level of security. Atomic Wallet provides instant exchange and 'buy crypto with a credit card' feature.
atomic.features: Buy Cryptocurrency (Visa, Master card), Exchange option, tez delegation

atomex.title: Atomex
atomex.description: Multicurrency HD wallet with built-in hybrid atomic swap exchange.
atomex.features: HD wallet, built-in hybrid atomic swap DEX

cortez.title: Cortez
cortez.description: Mobile wallet developed by Nomadic Labs.

galleon.title: Galleon
galleon.description: Galleon is a smart wallet for Tezos. Galleon is a deployment of Tezori, an open source wallet framework for Tezos, supporting both software and hardware wallets in eight languages on Mac, Windows and Linux.

kukai.title: Kukai
kukai.description: Kukai is a Tezos web wallet based on three principles: Security, Community and Reliability. Kukai supports HD wallets, Ledger connection and DirectAuth for one-Click login with your Google, Reddit or Twitter account.

magnum.title: Magnum Wallet
magnum.description: Magnum Wallet is a multicurrency non-custodial wallet service. Designed for those who wish to manage their crypto portfolio in a secure and convenient interface, it also lets the user earn rewards through staking or by claiming forks and bounty airdrops. As part of their “Multiply Your Funds” paradigm, the team is always on the lookout for new ways to benefit the users.
magnum.features: Blockchain Agnostic, In-App Exchange, Hardware Wallets, Ultimate Security, Passive Income, Forks & Bounties

paytomat.title: paytomat
paytomat.description: paytomat is a non-custodial wallet that brings financial services that modern customers eager. From exchanging assets, to referral programs, to trading BEP-2 tokens or accessing dApps and games, paytomat supports over 14 cryptocurrencies and covers all of a user's wants and needs in one single app.

simplestacking.title: simplestacking.com
simplestacking.description: Safe way to store & stake Tezos. Desktop & Web wallet with Trezor support.
simplestacking.features: Trezor T, multiple wallets, wallet balance history

tezbox.title: TezBox
tezbox.description: TezBox was the earliest functional GUI wallet for Tezos. TezBox has grown to be one of the major community developed wallets and will continue to provide users and developers with an easy to use, powerful and secure wallet.
tezbox.features: Secure, Mobile, Developer Friendly, Open Source, Hardware Wallet Support

block-detail.invalid-block_text: This block level is not valid.
block-detail.block-height_tooltip: The block height, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of the new block.
block-detail.baker_tooltip: A Baker takes part in the validation of the network.
block-detail.timestamp_tooltip: The date and time at which a block was created.
block-detail.value_tooltip: The total amount of Tezzies included in transactions for this block.
block-detail.transaction-fees_tooltip: The total amount of fees spent for transactions in this block.
block-detail.endorsed-slots_tooltip: A block has to be enndorsed by other bakers, up to 32 bakers confirm that this block is valid.
block-detail.cycle_tooltip: A Cycle is a set of consecutive blocks consisting out of 4095 blocks. Cycles are used as a unit of “time” in the block chain. For example, the different phases in the amendment voting procedures are defined based on cycles.
block-detail.cycle-position_tooltip: The position in number of blocks out of 4095 blocks.
block-detail.fitness_tooltip: Fitness is a metric used to compare contexts. For example, when several blocks claim to be heads of the chain, their context’s fitness are compared. The block with the highest fitness is selected as the head of the chain.
block-detail.protocol_tooltip: The active protocol of this block. The protocol can be changed through the protocol amendment proccess.

transaction-detail.invalid-operation-hash_text: This hash is currently invalid, it might not yet have been included in the blockchain.
transaction-detail.invalid-operation-hash_update: This page continuously updates to get the latest state.
transaction-detail.transaction-hash_tooltip: An identifier that is generated on transaction creation, used to uniquely identify a particular transaction.
transaction-detail.block_tooltip: The block height at which this transaction was included into the blockchain.
transaction-detail.timestamp_tooltip: The date and time at which this transaction was included in a block.
transaction-detail.value_tooltip: The total amount of Tezzies included in this transaction.
transaction-detail.transaction-fees_tooltip: The fees spent for this transaction.

account-detail.related-accounts_tooltip: Accounts that are either managed by this account or are the manager of this account.
account-detail.no-related-accounts: This account has no related accounts.
account-detail.not-delegated: This account has not been delegated.
account-detail.not-delegated_text: Delegate to a baker and contribute to the network validation and receive a reward back.
account-detail.placeholder: Search Baker by name or address
account-detail.delegated-account_tooltip: The first delegated account that is managed by this account. This can be the same account or an account that starts with KT1.
account-detail.amount_tooltip: The account balance of the delegated account shown above.
account-detail.next-reward-expected_tooltip: Shown is the expected time till to the end of the current cycle. Bakers normally pay out rewards a few hours into the new cycle.
account-detail.reward-amount_tooltip: The amount being paid out as reward by the baker for the delegation. This is the expected amount to be paid out, the baker split is alreay subtracted.
account-detail.baker_tooltip: A Baker takes part in the validation of the network with his balance and the balances of delegations.
account-detail.baker-split_tooltip: The baker split is a percentage taken by the baker as a reward for running his infrastrucutre. This split is decided by the baker, happens offchain and could also be 0%.
account-detail.invalid-address_text: This address is currently not visible on the blockchain.

contract-detail.name: Name
contract-detail.invalid-address_text: This address is currently not visible on the blockchain.

proposal-detail.details-of-proposal: Details of Proposal on Tezos Agora
proposal-detail.period-has-ended: period has ended, period was between

telegram-modal-component.title: Telegram Tezos Notifier Bot
telegram-modal-component.text_2: , you can stay up-to-date about accounts and be notified for delegations, transactions and much more directly in Telegram.
telegram-modal-component.notified-about: You'll be notified about the following address
telegram-modal-component.placeholder: Enter a name for this address
telegram-modal-component.name-too-long: The name can only have 18 characters

search-item.label: Search
search-item.placeholder: Search by Address / Alias / Transaction / Block

baker-overview.baking-bad_tooltip: Baking Bad provides a rating for bakers that meassures the accuracy and timeliness of their reward payouts to their delegators.

glossary-additional-terms.introduction: A comprehensive glossary for the various terminology used in the Tezos ecosystem.
glossary-additional-terms.account_description: An account is a unique identifier within protocol Alpha. There are different kinds of accounts (see Originated account and Delegate account). In the Context, each account is associated with a balance (an amount of tez available).
glossary-additional-terms.baking-endorsing-rights_description: A delegate is allowed to bake/endorse a block if he holds the baking/endorsement right for that block. At the start of a Cycle, baking and endorsement rights are computed for all the block heights in the cycle, based on the proportion of Rolls owned by each accounts. For each block height, there are several accounts that are allowed to bake. These different accounts are given different Priorities. For each block height, there are several accounts that are allowed to endorse. There can be multiple endorsements per block.
glossary-additional-terms.block_description: A block is a collection of several Operations. The operations are located in the payload of the block which is specific to the Economic Protocol. Along with the payload, the block includes a header which contains metadata. The metadata is agnostic to the economic protocol. It consists of generic information such as the block predecessor, a time stamp, etc.
glossary-additional-terms.block-hash_description: An identifier that is generated on block creation, used to uniquely identify a particular block.
glossary-additional-terms.delegate_description: An Implicit account to which an account has delegated their baking and endorsement rights. The Baking rights and Endorsement rights are calculated based on the total balance of tez that an account has been delegated to.
glossary-additional-terms.delegation_description: An operation in which an account balance is lent to a delegate. This increases the delegate’s rolls and consequently its Baking rights. The delegate does not control the funds from the account.
glossary-additional-terms.double-baking_description: When a baker signs two different blocks at the same height, it is called double baking. Double baking is detrimental to the network and might be indicative of an attempt to double spend. As such, it is punished by the network: an accuser can provide proof of the double baking to be awarded part of the baker’s deposit.
glossary-additional-terms.endorser_description: When a block is created and propagated on the network, nodes that have Endorsement rights for the matching block height can emit an endorsement operation. The accounts that emit the block are the endorsers of the block. The endorsement operations can be included in the next block to increase the block’s Score. Using the tools provided by Nomadic Labs, endorsement is handled by a separate binary.
glossary-additional-terms.frozen-balance_description: The sum of all bonds and rewards that are held when a baker endorses.
glossary-additional-terms.gas_description: A measure of the number of elementary operations performed during the execution of a smart contract. Gas is used to measure how much computing power is used to execute a smart contract.
glossary-additional-terms.node_description: A peer in the P2P network. It maintains a local state and propagates blocks and operations.
glossary-additional-terms.operation_description: Operations transform the context, this is what makes the state of the chain change. Operations are grouped into blocks so that the chain progresses in batches.
glossary-additional-terms.originated-account_description: Account which is associated to a Michelson script. They are created with an explicit origination operation and are therefore sometimes called originated accounts. The address of a smart contract always starts with the letters KT1.
glossary-additional-terms.origination_description: An operation to create a smart contract.
glossary-additional-terms.priority_description: A rank of different baking rights. Each rank corresponds to a time span. A baker with baking rights at a given priority is only allowed to bake during the priority’s corresponding time span. Baking outside of one’s designated priority, results in an invalid block.
glossary-additional-terms.reveal_description: A revealed account means the public key has been divulgated to the block chain. If it isn't revealed, the account won't be able to do operations such as transfers: this public key is used to assert that the account correctly signed operations.
glossary-additional-terms.roll_description: An amount of tez (e.g. 8000ꜩ) serving as a unit to determine delegates’ baking rights in a cycle. A delegate with twice as many rolls as another will be given twice as many rights to bake.
glossary-additional-terms.signature_description: A signature is a result of signing a message with a private key using the elliptic curve digital signature scheme
glossary-additional-terms.smart-contract_description: Account which is associated to a Michelson script. They are created with an explicit origination operation and are therefore sometimes called originated accounts. The address of a smart contract always starts with the letters KT1.
glossary-additional-terms.transaction_description: An operation to transfer tez between two accounts, or to run the code of a smart contract.
